Beccles Library

Manager: Annaliese Matheron-Avery

Blyburgate, Beccles
NR34 9TB

  • Tel: 01502 442820
  • Email: help@suffolklibraries.co.uk
  • Friends group: Beccles Library Community Trust
  • Facebook
  • Twitter

Opening hours

Day Hours
Monday 0930 – 1700
Tuesday 0930 – 1700
Wednesday 0930 – 1700
Thursday 0930 – 1700
Friday 0930 – 1930
Saturday 0930 – 1700
Sunday 1000 – 1600

Room & venue hire

Room and space hire at Beccles Library →

Branch facilities

  • Accessibility information
  • Payments: cash, cheques and cards accepted
  • Parking: public car park available with 6 free 1 hour spaces, paid parking also available
  • Out-of-hours book return available
  • Customer toilet
  • Refreshments: Fairtrade coffee machine and snacks for sale
  • Display space: Double-sided noticeboard for non-commercial event posters
  • Which? available - ask staff for magazine or to log in
  • Also available:
    • East Suffolk Council customer services. Visit the East Suffolk Council website for opening times.
    • 1940s, 1950s, 1960s and 1970s memory boxes available to local borrowers for up to three weeks. No library card required. Contact the library for more information.

IT and printing facilities

  • Free wifi
  • Book a computer
  • Photocopying: available
  • Colour printing: available
  • Scan to email
  • Printing, photocopying & scanning charges

Regular events and activities

Children's events

Baby Bounce and Tot Rock

Friday, 1100-1200

Songs and rhymes for babies and toddlers.

Find out more about our Bookstart sessions

Children's crafts

Sunday, 1300-1400

Family playtime: for 0-4 year olds

Thursday, 1000-1130

Grandparents and grandchildren sessions

Wednesday, 1000-1130

Free play and talk for grandparents and 0-5 year-old grandchildren.

Knowledge Knights: crafts and games for children aged 7+

Monday, 1545-1645

£1 per participant, different theme each week, no need to book

Lego Club: £1 suggested donation

third Sunday of the month., 1000-1100

Ministry of the Mind: Teenage wellbeing group

Thursday, 1600-1700

A different wellbeing task every week, from yoga to meditation, bullet journaling to art therapy. No one will be turned away but £1 donation appreciated.

TinyTalk baby signing

Tuesday, 1130-1230

To book your place contact Charlotte Ling on 07419322204 or charlottel@tinytalk.co.uk

TinyTalk toddler classes

Tuesday, 1015-1115

To book your place contact Charlotte Ling on 07419322204 or charlottel@tinytalk.co.uk

Older people's events

Top Time: events, activities for older people, with refreshments

Thursday, 1400-1500

  • First Thursday of the month: Reading group
  • Second Thursday of the month: Quiz for individuals - free, drop in
  • Third Thursday of the month: Guest speaker - free, drop in
  • Fourth Thursday of the month: Bingo - free, drop in
  • Fifth Thursday of the month (where applicable): Crafts with Vicky - £2.50 per person, booking essential

Reading groups

Poetry group

last Friday of the month, 1400-1500

Reading group

first Monday of the month, 1900-2030

For more information contact Ruth Sainsbury at ruthsainsbury@yahoo.co.uk

Top Time reading group

first Thursday of the month, 1400-1500

Writing groups

Creative writing group

first Tuesday of the month, 1400-1600

For more information contact Helen on 01502 714161 / htpoet5@gmail.com or Lorraine on 01502 470853 / bennettlorraine1@gmail.com

IT help

Absolute Beginners in computers: book in advance (4 week course)

Wednesday, 0900-1030

Internet and email sessions for beginners: book in advance (4 week course)

Thursday, 0900-1030

Tablet and eReader training sessions for beginners: book in advance

Tuesday every 2 weeks, 0900-1000

Language courses

French open chat drop-in sessions: all welcome and no booking required

Saturday every 2 weeks, 1000-1100

German conversation group

second and fourth Tuesday of the month, 1400-1600

For those with some previous knowledge of conversational German.

Arts, crafts & games

Beccles Banner project

Friday, 1400-1600; 1700-1900 every fourth week

All are welcome to help us make a mixed media textile retelling of the history of Beccles. Some materials, and refreshments provided.

Gardening Club

Wednesday, 1400-1530

All welcome, no experience necessary. Wear appropriate clothes and shoes and bring your own gardening gloves.

Tabletop Crusaders: drop in and join in with a variety of games

Friday, 1800-2100

£1 entry.

Health & wellbeing events

Ministry of the Mind: Teenage wellbeing group

Thursday, 1600-1700

A different wellbeing task every week, from yoga to meditation, bullet journaling to art therapy. No one will be turned away but £1 donation appreciated.

Wellbeing Wednesdays

Wednesday, 1400-1500

All welcome for wellbeing practices such as colouring and journalling. A different activity every week.

Yoga

Wednesday, various

Contact the library for more details and to book. £3.50 per one-hour session

History

Family history sessions: book in advance

Thursday, 1500-1600
